newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico 97 trade surplus seen at $2.0 bln - IMEF.
newsitem.headline: Mexico 97 trade surplus seen at $2.0 bln - IMEF.

text.p: Mexico will end the year with a trade surplus of about $2.0 billion, compared with a surplus of about $6.5 billion at the end of 1996, the Mexican Institute of Financial Executives (IMEF) said on Tuesday.

"For the full year we still believe that we will have a trade surplus, but it could be that in the last months of the year we have a deficit. For the full year we estimate a trade surplus of about $2.0 billion," Oscar Vera, head of economic research at IMEF, said at a news conference.
